content.title: Free Supply of Note Books to the Children of Poor Widows
content.department: Social Welfare and Nutritious Meal Programme Department
content.details: The scheme 'Free Supply of Note Books to the Children of Poor Widows' was launched by the Social Welfare and Nutritious Meal Programme Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to supply notebooks to children of poor widows studying up to higher secondary courses. The scheme has been extended to children in govt. children's homes and service homes.
benefits: 1st to 2nd Standard – Books worth ₹50/- (per child per annum)
3rd to 5th Standard - Books worth ₹125/- (per child per annum)
6th to 8th Standard - Books worth ₹175/- (per child per annum)
9th to 10th Standard - Books worth ₹300/- (per child per annum)
11th to 12th Standard - Books worth ₹600/- (per child per annum)
eligibility: The applicant should be a child of a poor widow
The applicant should be a student
The applicant should be studying in higher secondary
The applicant's family income should not exceed ₹24,000/- per annum
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the District Social Welfare Officer/Extension Officer (SW)/Rural Welfare Officer (Women) and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Fill in all mandatory fields, attach copies of all mandatory documents, and submit the application form to the District Social Welfare Officer/Extension Officer (SW)/Rural Welfare Officer (Women). Request a receipt or acknowledgment upon submission.
documents_required: Necessary Certificate from the Government Children's Home / Service Home
Recommendation Certificate (issued by the headmaster/headmistress of the school with details of class)

faqs.question: What is the primary objective of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective is to supply notebooks to children of poor widows studying up to the higher secondary course.

faqs.question: Are children in government children's homes eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme has been extended to children in Government Children Homes and Service Homes.

faqs.question: When are the benefits of the scheme provided to the children?
faqs.answer: The benefits are provided at the beginning of the academic year.

faqs.question: Is there an age limit for children to qualify for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No specific age limit is mentioned in the scheme.

faqs.question: Which officers can be contacted for more information about the scheme?
faqs.answer: District Social Welfare Officer, Extension Officer (SW), and Rural Welfare Officer (Women) can be contacted for more information.

faqs.question: What is the probable time limit for processing applications?
faqs.answer: Applications are processed at the beginning of the academic year.

faqs.question: Who should grievances regarding the scheme be reported to at the district level?
faqs.answer: Grievances should be reported to District Collectors or District Social Welfare Officers at the district level.

faqs.question: Who should be contacted at the state level for issues related to the scheme?
faqs.answer: Issues at the state level should be reported to the Director of Social Welfare, Chepauk, Chennai-600 005.

faqs.question: What is the income limit for a family to be eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The family income should not exceed ₹24,000/- per annum.

faqs.question: What recommendation is needed from the school for the application?
faqs.answer: A recommendation from the headmaster/headmistress of the school with details of the class is needed.
